# Introduction {.headline-only background-color="#0333ff"}

## Discussion {.html-hidden .unlisted .discussion-slide background-color=black}

:::large
What to you **expect** from this course?
:::

## General remarks

:::medium
You will gain [**an overview** of the interplay of sustainability and IS,]{.fragment .fade-in} 
[learn about **the complexity and trade offs** involved,]{.fragment .fade-in}
[and discover how IS impacts the dimensions of sustainability through **specific examples**.]{.fragment .fade-in}
:::


# Learning objectives

During this course, you should advance your skills in the following areas:

:::incremental
- understanding of the **concept of sustainable development (SD)** and its significance in contemporary society,
- knowledge of **key principles and frameworks related to sustainable development**,
- Awareness and appraisal of different **sustainability metrics and measures**.
- appreciation of **the role of information systems (IS)** in addressing sustainability challenges,
- understanding of **relevant concepts and theories**,
- **critical thinking skills** to identify complex challenges and possible solutions,
- **communication of conclusions** and the underlying knowledge, 
- and **social and ethical responsibilities** in uncertain and ambiguous contexts.
:::

You will gain 5 ECTS for this course. This equals approx. __90 hours workload__, of which you need most to pass the course.

-	Lectures (approx. 20 hours)
- Preparation (approx. 10 hours)
- Presentation (remaining time)

:::fragment
It is very important that you reserve enough time to attend the classes AND prepare your presentation (see @tbl-schedule for details).
:::

# Examination

:::medium
Graded will be 
[your **description of an example for IS for SD**,]{.fragment .fade-in} 
[a theory-guided analysis of the **process and outcomes**]{.fragment .fade-in} 
[as well as your **ability do critically discuss** the example.]{.fragment .fade-in}
:::

:::notes
The grade will be a combination of

- your **presentation** of your case     
- the **discussion** after the presentation      
- and your **contributions to the discussion of your fellow students' presentations**   

Details regarding the assignment can be found [here](../assignment/).

:::
